snippet: Joselyn Martinez scoured the Internet for years before she came across Justo Santos, who, the police say, has admitted to shooting her father in Upper Manhattan in November 1986.
abstract: Joselyn Martinez, testifying before Justice Robert M Stolz of State Supreme Court in Manhattan, recounts her 25-year search for fugitive Justo Santos, accused of murdering her father in Upper Manhattan in 1986; unusual hearing will weigh evidence to determine if Santos's right to a speedy trial was violated when police and district attorney's office waited 26 years to arrest him.
lead_paragraph: Joselyn Martinez scoured the Internet for years before she came across Justo Santos, who, the police say, has admitted to shooting her father in Upper Manhattan in November 1986.

headline.main: At Unusual Hearing, Daughter Recounts 25-Year Quest to Catch Father’s Killer
headline.print_headline: At Unusual Hearing, Daughter Recounts 25-Year Quest to Catch Father’s Killer
